intro: Potentilla decora, commonly known as the showy potentilla, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring multiple stems covered in small, rounded leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Potentilla decora is also valued for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various growing conditions.
